discourse_list.title: Informal poll on support for Rune's Endgame proposal

content.content: Now that more of the details have been filled in, I want to reassess support for the EndGame, similar to the August poll For background, see the endgame tag. This kind of one-person-one-vote poll is important. Even if Rune forces approval of his proposal because he wields a lot of MKR weight, if the community and workforce don’t support the EndGame then (at worst) everybody will resign/leave—a dire outcome. The poll is set to trust_level_2, the same as a signal, and voting is anonymous.    Do you support the End Game plan?  Yes No Abstain     0 voters     This is an informal poll and no action will be taken as a result.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on the EndGame proposal and has set up an informal poll to reassess support for it. The poll is open to the community and voting is anonymous. The author emphasizes the importance of community support for the proposal and encourages everyone to participate in the poll.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
None

content.content: In particular, the current proposal seemed much better to the previous one, being realistic with the events of the End Game regulations, it is a good escape and would increase our power in the decentralized network, but synthesizing the communities even more would not make the understanding much more responsive to users? Since 5 summarized themes were taken to encompass everything that is End Game
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

None of the topics listed match

content.content: I sincerely look forward to this endgame, however maybe a bear market is not a good time for it, oh maybe yes, decentralizing was always the vision of MakerDAO and I see endgame as a way to improve processes we have in our DAO.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: I think this is very worth doing. I suspect that a more granular poll, similar to this Clean Money - Exploratory Sentiment Polling  might be even more useful, given the wide-ranging complexity of Endgame as it stands. At the least, it would help indicate elements of the plan needed more work / outreach in order to create a consensus.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: LongForWisdom:  I suspect that a more granular poll   Agree, assuming that Rune is willing to work toward consensus. One motivation for this poll was to convince Rune not to force approval of the current draft. As of today, with only 29% (of 55) voting in favor, suggest that the Endgame could certainly benefit from more refinement.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: psychonaut:  As of today, with only 29% (of 55) voting in favor, suggest that the Endgame could certainly benefit from more refinement.   19/55 (~34%) of abstains also seem to suggest that the poll was quite ambiguous and/or not easy to answer in a YES/NO way.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: The ambiguous message gives me to understand that the endgame proposal is so long and extensive that it is possible that most of the participants possibly did not read about endgame.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Obviously it will be ambiguous, in addition to being extensive, some data is imprecise, if in the first proposal it did not set absolutely nothing for RWA and after that was criticized, it applied a percentage of the liquidity of the protocol for RWA, if it was changed last At that point, you can change the proposals again. As I have always said, I love what is proposed in End Game but all the information must be synthesized into something more didactic to understand
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This poll is far too simplistic to be useful in any real way.
Your feedback is far too simplistic to be useful in any real way.

I’m new to MakerDAO, I tried to read about Rune’s Endgame but didn’t fully understand it.  I am interested to know about the whole plan.  Is there any place where I can fully understand the Endgame step by step.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: I would check out LongForWisdom’s latest summaries    LongForWisdom  LFW  Current : GovAlpha Core Unit Member  June 2020 - June 2022 : Governance Facilitator @ MakerDAO Joined June 28, 2019        Endgame Index List Governance   Endgame V3  Endgame V3 Full Post Endgame V3 Summary (LOD2)  Endgame Concept LOD Summaries What are LOD Summaries?LOD summaries are organized into sections summarizing the same information in different levels of detail.   LOD0 represents the most-simplified and abstracted version of this concept LOD1 is more complex and more accurate. LOD2 is a direct summary of Rune’s post. Runes post could be considered LOD3, with the highest level of detail and explanation.  Lower numbers = Easier to grasp …       LFWs Endgame Commentary Governance       Feels like this should go without saying with that title. But to be explicit: these thoughts and comments represent my personal position, rather than GovAlpha’s.    LFWs Endgame Commentary  Aims  Highlight perceived risks with the Endgame plan that may have gone under-examined. Encourage changes in how the Endgame plan is realised to avoid the situation where Maker is locked into doing or continuing to do something that is not working. Suggest simplifications to the proposed Endgame structure.  …

3rd party auditing and reviewing proposal

content.content: Closing the poll here. The August poll only received 73 votes and we got 87 here.
Mmmm this says a lot about community’s feelings. Maybe they all are not prepared for what’s coming or don’t know much about it, still very interesting, thanks for the poll @psychonaut !
